Wisdom.description: Represents abstract thought and common sense. It increases the rate at which you become more proficient with spells

Perception.description: Represents your senses, memory, and accumulated knowledge. It increases the amount and specificity of information you can quickly gain about your surroundings

Fortitude.description: Represents your strength, stamina, and willpower. It is used when calculating your maximum health points

Agility.description: Represents your coordination and the speed of your reflexes. It aids in your ability to quickly and precisely move your body

Social.description: How well you navigate social situations such as diplomatic confrontations, haggling, and dinnertime conversation.

Survival.description: Your ability to survive in the wilderness. Used for hunting, navigation, and foraging.

First Aid.description: Your ability to tend and treat wounds without spells or potions.

Engineering.description: Your ability to invent mechanical devices

Dexterity.description: Your motor control. Makes your attacks more accurate

Strength.description: You physical strength. Increases the power of melee and thrown attacks

Acrobatics.description: Used for diving, rolling, and breaking falls, jumping, climbing, and balance

Performance.description: Performance of a specific task. Essentially your ability to act on knowledge

Stamina.description: your ability to keep up strenuous activities. Essentially cardio. Mainly affects how long you can run and how well you can swim (and fly and dig)
